sentence.Network_en: Eleanor will be back any moment, if she doesn't dawdle.
sentence.Network_cn: 如果不闲荡的话，埃莉诺随时都会回来。

sentence.Network_en: Don't dawdle , the young head is soon white.
sentence.Network_cn: 莫等闲, 白了少年头.

sentence.Network_en: Look smart, don't dawdle about like that.
sentence.Network_cn: 快一点, 别这么拖拖拉拉!

rather than continuing dawdling diplomacy it would be prudent for the US to a cease-fire .相对于继续拖延时间的外交斡旋，对美国来说实现停火是个更谨慎的选择。

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: related to dialect daddle, doddle 'dally'

entry.def: If you dawdle, you spend more time than is necessary going somewhere.

example.ex: Eleanor will be back any moment, if she doesn't dawdle...
example.tran: 如果不闲荡的话，埃莉诺随时都会回来。

example.ex: They dawdled arm in arm past the shopfronts.
example.tran: 他们手挽手慢悠悠地逛过一家家店面。

entry.def: If you dawdle over something, you spend more time than is necessary doing something.

example.ex: He got fed up as bank staff dawdled over cashing him a cheque...
example.tran: 银行职员慢吞吞地给他兑现支票，他憋了一肚子气。

example.ex: She downed two glasses of white wine while I dawdled over a draught beer.
example.tran: 我慢悠悠地呷着一杯散装啤酒的工夫她已经灌下了两杯白葡萄酒。

means.word_mean: 3. hang (back) or fall (behind) in movement, progress, development, etc.

auth_sentence.content: "We've dawdled, and if we dawdle more it will get even worse," Schneider says.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: "We've dawdled, and if we dawdle more it will get even worse," Schneider says.

auth_sentence.content: We also found that just knowing our activities were being watched made us a bit less likely to dawdle on non-work-related sites.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: We also found that just knowing our activities were being watched made us a bit less likely to dawdle on non-work-related sites.

auth_sentence.content: He chuckled with Dan Warthen, the pitching coach, about a member of the staff who tends to dawdle on the mound.
auth_sentence.res_content: He chuckled with Dan Warthen, the pitching coach, about a member of the staff who tends to dawdle on the mound.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He chuckled with Dan Warthen, the pitching coach, about a member of the staff who tends to dawdle on the mound.

sentences.en: Billy dawdled behind her all morning.
sentences.cn: 比利整个上午都跟在她后面闲混。
